intro: Xylopia tenuipetala, commonly known as the slender-fruited xylopia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces globose, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Xylopia tenuipetala is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
